N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 1200.5.6 - Restrictions on right to practice

State Regulations
(a) A lawyer shall not participate in
offering or making: (1)
a
partnership, shareholder, operating, employment, or other similar type of
agreement that restricts the right of a lawyer to practice after termination of
the relationship, except an agreement concerning benefits upon retirement; or
(2)
an agreement
in which a restriction on a lawyer's right to practice is part of the
settlement of a client controversy. (b) This Rule does not
prohibit restrictions that may be included in the terms of the sale of a law
practice pursuant to Rule 1.17. Notes
